meanings.definition: Having an uneven or irregular surface
meanings.sent1: The rough road made the car bump up and down.
meanings.sent2: She used sandpaper to smooth out the rough edges of the wood.
meanings.sent3: The rough surface of the sidewalk made it hard to ride a skateboard.
meanings.sent4: The rough terrain of the mountain tested the hiker's endurance.
meanings.sent5: The rough texture of the fabric scratched my skin.

meanings.sent1: The rough table wobbled because one leg was shorter.
meanings.sent2: The painter applied a second coat to cover the rough spots on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The rough ground caused the ball to bounce unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: The rough sea made the boat sway back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The rough path was difficult to walk on in the dark.

meanings.sent1: The rough sound of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent2: The rough voice of the singer grated on my ears.
meanings.sent3: The rough noise of the construction site disturbed the peace of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The rough music blared from the car speakers, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent5: The rough tone of his speech made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: He handled the delicate vase with a rough touch and it broke.
meanings.sent2: The rough handling of the fragile package caused it to tear open.
meanings.sent3: The rough play of the puppies knocked over the flower pot.
meanings.sent4: The rough treatment of the book led to its pages getting torn.
meanings.sent5: The rough manner in which he spoke hurt her feelings.

meanings.sent1: The rough storm uprooted trees and caused power outages.
meanings.sent2: The rough waves crashed against the shore during the hurricane.
meanings.sent3: The rough wind howled through the night, keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent4: The rough river currents made it dangerous to swim.
meanings.sent5: The rough behavior of the crowd escalated into chaos.
